title: 115_s2031
content: The "Kisatchie National Forest Land Conveyance Act" authorizes the conveyance of certain Federal land in Louisiana for market value consideration. Key definitions include Collins Camp Properties, Secretary of Agriculture, and the State of Louisiana. SEC. 4. AUTHORIZATION OF CONVEYANCES, KISATCHIE NATIONAL FOREST, LOUISIANA. The Secretary is authorized to convey Federal land in Louisiana by quitclaim deed, including competitive sale methods. The land includes all Federal land within sec. 9, T. 10 N., R. 5 W., Winn Parish, and a 2.16-acre parcel in sec. 4, T. 10 N., R. 5 W. The Secretary is authorized to convey Federal land in Louisiana by quitclaim deed, including a 2.16-acre parcel in sec. 4, T. 10 N., R. 5 W., Winn Parish, to Collins Camp Properties within a 1-year period. The Secretary is authorized to convey Federal land in Louisiana to Collins Camp Properties by quitclaim deed, including up to 47.92 acres of land in Winn Parish and another parcel described in subsection (a)(2)(B). The Secretary may configure the land to maximize marketability. The Secretary has the authority to configure and establish terms for the conveyance of Federal land under this Act to maximize marketability or achieve management objectives. Consideration for the conveyance must be in cash and equal to the market value of the land being conveyed. The market value of Federal land conveyed under this Act is determined by an appraisal conducted according to specific standards or by competitive sale. In any conveyance of Federal land under this Act, the Secretary must disclose hazardous substances but is not required to remediate them. This section does not affect the application of the Comprehensive Environmental Response, Compensation, and Liability Act to the conveyance of Federal land. SEC. 5. PROCEEDS FROM THE SALE OF LAND. The Secretary shall deposit the proceeds of a conveyance of Federal land under section 4 in the fund established under Public Law 90-171 (16 U.S.C. 484a). SEC. 6. ADMINISTRATION. (a) Costs.--Collins Camp Properties must pay reasonable appraisal costs and the cost of any required administrative and environmental analyses for the conveyance of Federal land. (b) Permits.--An offer for acquisition of Federal land must include a statement from each holder of a Forest Service special use authorization agreeing to relinquish it. The holder of a special use authorization on Federal land must agree to relinquish it to Collins Camp Properties upon conveyance. Failure to provide written authorization will result in Collins Camp Properties administering the authorization until its expiration date. Collins Camp Properties administers the special use authorization until it expires.
